basics.name: Lucy Moglia
basics.label: Research Engineer
basics.summary: I am interested in how systems work and how they fail. Electrical engineering is my focus, following from an abiding interest in systems theory/control theory met with a concrete desire to build systems. At Kyocera-AVX I have been reverse engineering a wide array of products, evaluating prototype components, and researching emerging application areas to assist our product development and market engineering teams.

work.name: Self Employed Hardware Designer
work.description: Contracting and consulting work for an array of startups
work.summary: PCB design, rapid prototyping, embedded devevlopment, RF performance testing, and more
highlights: Developed a number of demos which helped secure startups funding
Provided rapid turnaround PCB design and testing services
Early-stage hardware consulting, assisting founders in understanding their products' technical requirements
Lab specification and equipment recommendations, process initialization and calibration
Performance analysis
Failure mode analysis

work.name: Atopile
work.summary: Built hardware using Atopile's domain-specific language for PCB design.
highlights: Developed MicroMPPT, a 5W autonomous multi-chemistry solar charger with autonomous perturb-and-observe, now distributed by a number of third-party sellers
Developed a series of home assistant control panels
Developed a high-altitude balloon payload with LoRa telemetry
Testing/debugging prototype features

work.name: Kyocera-AVX
work.summary: Kyocera-AVX is an American electronics component manufacturer specializing in passive components such as antennas, MLCCs, tantalum capacitors, supercapacitors, and varistors.
highlights: Performed teardowns on a wide variety of products and systems on behalf of market research and engineering teams.

Reverse-engineered systems to assist product design and market research teams; produced schematics and component models from product samples; evaluated samples and prototype components to assess suitability for given products/applications of interest.

work.name: Machinic Garden LLC
work.description: Provided contract engineering and manufacturing services to startups and small businesses.
work.summary: Contract Engineering and Manufacturing Services, Small-Scale Manufacturing
highlights: Designed prototype PCBs to client specifications and designed processes to address specialty needs (e.g., copper nanoparticle airbrush coating and electroplating of 3D-printed parts).

Acquisition and integration of a wide variety of small-scale manufacturing and test equipment including 3D printers, laser cutters, arc welders, drill presses, oscilloscopes, CNC mills, and reflow ovens.
(KiCAD, Fusion360)

Managed a shop website and several storefronts such as Etsy and Amazon; managed AdSense; and handled order processing and shipping for an array of products including t-shirts, laser-engraved coasters/signs, 3D prints, and electronics kits.
Full-stack Embedded Development (C/C++, MicroPython, Arduino, ATTiny, ARM Cortex-M, STM32, ESP32/8266, Teensy, RP2040, SAMD21/51)

work.name: Electrolux
work.summary: Electrolux is an Swedish multinational home electronics manufacturer specializing in appliances such as fridges and washing machines.
highlights: Assisted engineers in PCB and firmware development and validation.
Performed IEC/UL compliance testing, evaluated hardware and firmware revisions with LabVIEW, NI embedded PCs, and custom Arduino-based test hardware.
Used OrCAD, LabVIEW, National Instruments PXI, and a wide array of electronics lab equipment.
Assisted in development of EOL test fixtures

volunteer.summary: Community garden project in Anderson, SC. Provides food to local food banks, hosts community events, and actively working on renovations with the hope to host many additional resources
highlights: 501c nonprofit organization. https://www.cleobailey.org/
Coordinated with university student organizations and community groups to organize volunteer efforts and plan events.
Managed and participated in the planning and construction of a wide array of construction, renovation, and gardening projects.
Assorted gardening, farm work, construction, and fabrication work

Assisted in the design and implementation of an array of low-cost, experimental construction and gardening methods, such as 'DIY' irrigation systems made from PVC pipes and low-cost rainwater collection/distribution systems.

awards.title: OpenSauce 2025 Exhibitor
awards.summary: OpenSauce, year two. This time we presented 'Richard Nixon's Head in a Jar', an interactive animatronic Nixon robot with silicone skin plugged into a fine tuned LLM and voice model.

awards.title: OpenSauce 2024 Exhibitor
awards.summary: An event for engineers, student groups, open source developers, makers, and startups to exhibit something they've been working on. You hear my application on the Safety Third podcast here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NeMPYlnSd-g&t=5884s

projects.name: Micromppt
projects.description: Low-cost 5W autonomous solar charger with embedded perturb-and-observe setpoint adjustment. Designed for use with Meshtastic and other low power embedded devices. Now sold and distributed by a number of Meshtastic community hardware developers.

projects.name: NonHumanScent, Artificial Olfaction
projects.description: Designed electronic olfaction gas composition sensors and developed open-source edge ML electronic olfaction dev kits.

projects.name: Cultured Neurons at Frontier Tower
projects.description: Developing techniques for Frontier Tower's neurotech floor to read and stimulate cultured neurons, including maskless MEA fabrication process, biocompatible fluid exchange systems, and custom signal acquisition boards

projects.name: NFC/LED Chip Implant
projects.description: Self-surgery to install an xSIID NFC/LED chip in the webbing of my left hand

projects.name: Voices In The Radio
projects.description: OS-agnostic GPT fine-tuning toolchain used in my OpenSauce 2024 exhibit. Automates scraping and processing large quantities of text from a variety of source file types, filtering this data with chunk distinctiveness scoring, and automating the fine-tuning process via OpenAI's API. Additionally, provides tools to automate the assignment of fine-tuned models to Discord bots and the assignment of a voice via the Eleven Labs TTS API. Our OpenSauce booth included a terminal to interact with the models we trained this way, which would then speak to the user through a suite of FM radios with the use of an ESP32 and SI4713 FM Transmitter IC.
